name: Cyclohexane

energies.comment: Saturated 6-membered ring. Chair conformation has minimal angle strain (~0-2 kJ/mol) but still has geometric correlation. Tests whether cycles amplify correlation even WITHOUT π-conjugation. Predicted violation: +20 to +50 kJ/mol from pure geometric feedback (atoms constrained in cycle). Much less than benzene (+148) or naphthalene (+254), but potentially more than acyclic hexane would show.

reference_energies.comment: Standard bond energies (kJ/mol) for naive calculation. Naive = 6(C-C) + 12(C-H) = 6(346) + 12(413) = 7032 kJ/mol

notes: Cyclohexane is saturated (no π-electrons, no conjugation)
Chair conformation minimizes angle and torsional strain
Still forms a CYCLE - geometric constraints create correlation
Tests: Can geometric cycles alone amplify additivity violations?
Predicted violation: +20 to +50 kJ/mol (geometric correlation only)
Compare to benzene (+148, geometric + electronic) and hexatriene (+43, electronic only)
If violation is significant, suggests feedback loops work for ANY correlated cycle
If violation is minimal, suggests π-conjugation is necessary for amplification
This helps distinguish geometric vs electronic contributions to feedback
